Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Peptide g (Synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich; N-terminal fragment of PMAP-36, UCLL1c, XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (60%) tohybrid CM15K: 38%; L=I: 15%. GRAVY: 0.145; M Wt:  2569.131; M formula: C126H186N36O21S1; Mol ex coeff: 22200.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 4 uM), S-aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC >64 uM), A. baumannii ATCC 19606 (MIC 2 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC 8 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 8 uM), S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 4 uM). Noticably, this 13mer retained activity against Gram- bacteria similar to PMAP-36.Toxicity: not toxic (hemo-lytic: ram RBC) at 32 uM.Structure: helical in SDS or TFE.
Literature Information.Author: Biondi B, de Pascale L, Mardirossian M, Di Stasi A, Favaro M, Scocchi M, Peggion C. 2023
Literature Information.Title: Structural and biological characterization of shortened derivatives of the cathelicidin PMAP-36
